From: Mike Clark <mike@...>

--- Ilja_Preu? <I.Preuss@...> wrote:
> > It's possible to explicitly define the test method order in
> > the suite() method, as in...
> >
> >      public static Test suite() {
> >          TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> >          suite.addTest(new ExampleTestCase("testA"));
> >          suite.addTest(new ExampleTestCase("testB"));
> >          suite.addTest(new ExampleTestCase("testC"));
> >          return suite;
> >      }
> 
> You are right that the tests *happen* to be executed in the order
> they are
> added to the suite. But I don't think that it is the *required*
> (specified)
> behaviour of a suite. Howsoever, I would try hardly to get my tests
> to be
> independent of each other!
> 

Agreed.  They are executed in this order only because the underlying
collection is ordered - an implementation detail not to be depended
upon.  I also agree that tests should be independent; however, the
original poster was aware of these recommendations and willing to
accept the implications.

Mike
